item.title: OpenAI Is Pivoting To Porn
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre getting more Halo games, but which ones?  Can Battlefield really threaten Call of Duty for the military shooter crown? And is the future of OpenAI really a porn bot service? Welcome to the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily roundup of gaming culture and news. I‚Äôm getting this one out extra early to make up for yesterday. Tron: Ares bombed at the box office with a $33 million debut that Hollywood insiders believe will doom Jared Leto and the franchise. That‚Äôs a shame because I saw it last night and it didn‚Äôt suck nearly as much as I expected. I would even say the first half of it was pretty great!

OpenAI is getting ready to unleash ‚Äúerotica for verified adults‚Äù

A big sexting update is coming to ChatGPT in December, Sam Altman teased on X this week. ‚ÄúWe made ChatGPT pretty restrictive to make sure we were being careful with mental health issues,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúWe realize this made it less useful/enjoyable to many users who had no mental health problems, but given the seriousness of the issue we wanted to get this right.‚Äù

Having unfurled the aircraft carrier ‚ÄúMission Accomplished!‚Äù sign despite ongoing wrongful death lawsuits, Altman says it‚Äôs time to embrace easily outmaneuvered age-verification tools and treat people like grownups. ‚ÄúIn December, as we roll out age-gating more fully and as part of our ‚Äòtreat adult users like adults‚Äô principle, we will allow even more, like erotica for verified adults,‚Äù he concluded. It sounds like the trillion-dollar bubble is going back to the chattier and more sycophantic version of ChatGPT that paying users got hooked on earlier in the year.

Master Chief‚Äôs voice is teasing a big Halo announcement

Steve Downes, the voice of Master Chief, is plugging the Halo World Championships later this month where he will appear with Cortana voice actor Jen Taylor. ‚ÄúPS: BIG NEWS A‚ÄôCOMIN!!‚Äù he posted on X. We already know a Halo: Combat Evolved remake is in the works but could Microsoft be ready to peel back the curtain on the next chapter of the sci-fi franchise as well? The tech giant previously promised to reveal the future of Halo at the esports tournament on October 25-26.

PS Plus leans into Halloween with more horror game additions

October‚Äôs tentpole game for PS Plus Extra is last year‚Äôs PS5-exclusive remake of Silent Hill 2, but according to billbil-kun at Dealabs Magazine, the remaster of Until Dawn will also be joining the subscription service lineup. Horror adventure As Dusk Falls and vampire survival sandbox V Rising will apparently be coming to PS Plus this month as well.

Battlefield 6 is off to a roaring start

Data firm Alinea Analytics is projecting launch weekend sales of 6.5 million copies. The majority of those are on PC, with roughly 45 percent divided surprisingly evenly between PS5 and Xbox Series X/S. If accurate, that‚Äôs a solid rebound for the franchise, though nowhere near the momentum of previous Call of Duty games. item.title: DJI Osmo Action 5 Pro Combo Hits Its Lowest Price to Clear Out Final Units, Now Cheaper Than Older GoPro Models
item.content:encoded:
Recording your adventures is a great way to revisit and relive them later, or even share them with the world. But your smartphone camera or traditional options can only take you so far. To get those professional results in all lighting and weather conditions, you might want to consider investing in a DJI action camera, and now is a great time to grab one without paying the full price.

Amazon has dropped the price of the DJI Osmo Action 5 Pro essential combo to $269, giving you 21% off on one of the best action cameras out there. The deal won‚Äôt be around for too long, so we highly recommend getting your orders in sooner rather than later.

See at Amazon

Stunning Visuals On the Go

The Action 5 Pro camera comes with all the essential features you need for a minimal yet powerful setup. You‚Äôre getting the all-new 1/1.3-inch sensor paired with a 13.5-stop dynamic range for clear images in both bright and dim settings. It shoots 4K video at up to 120fps, and the advanced 4nm chip makes sure the subject stays in focus even during motion in both horizontal (16:9) and vertical (9:16) formats. There‚Äôs a built-in color temperature sensor to automatically adjust white balance for lifelike results, as well.

Then you‚Äôve got front and rear ultra-bright OLED touchscreens to capture moments without a lot of fumbling around. You can frame and check your shots on the go within seconds. And for when you don‚Äôt want to bother with buttons, there‚Äôs voice support with always-on recognition to control the camera hands-free within a one-meter range. The camera also plays nicely with the DJI Mic 2 and Mic Mini, so you will also enjoy crisp, clear audio without needing a separate receiver.

The built-in 1950mAh battery can last up to 4 hours on a full charge, while a quick 15-minute top-up can get you an additional 2 hours of filming. Plus, the camera is IP68-rated waterproof up to 20 meters, and can even handle extreme cold (as low as -20 degrees) quite well.

All things considered, this action camera can be a great investment for all the outdoor enthusiasts looking to film their adventures in the wild. You‚Äôre not just getting a solid visual quality but also a reliable battery life, handy touchscreens, easy controls, and much more. Grab it for less while it‚Äôs still discounted.

item.title: Baseus 10-in-1 Charging Station Drops Even Lower Than Prime Day Pricing, Practically Free Power for USB-C and USB-A Devices
item.content:encoded:
So much of the crap we own is beholden to a long cable and fat adapter to make it work. Our phones, our headphones, even our watches now all have a lithium battery that needs to be charged on the regular. When you need to plug in more than one device at a time, suddenly you space feels like a cobweb of cables running all directions, creating a tangled mess. Or worse, they don‚Äôt all fit. So now you‚Äôre on the hunt for multiple free wall outlets to get your AirPods up and running again just so you can relisten to the Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 soundtrack while you work. Thankfully, you can take control of your stress and clutter with a good charging station. Baseus has a 10-in-1 desktop charge of which Amazon knocked 40% off the price. The charger normally goes for $50, but the discount ends up saving you an even $20. That means you only have to pay $30 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

Multi-Device Charging

This all-in-one charging block combines 10 different ports so you can charge up as many as 10 devices simultaneously. Between them all, you get six AC outlets, three USB-C ports, and one standard USB-A port. With a wide spread of options, you shouldn‚Äôt have any issue charging your various devices without the need for a unique charging block. You can just plug your device directly into the unit. In the event you still end up needing to plug an adapter into the AC outlet, you shouldn‚Äôt have that common problem of the block taking up multiple slots on the power strip. On the Baseus charger, each outlet faces a different direction to allow for better flexibility.

Designed for desktops and nightstands, the Baseus charging station comes with an adhesive strip for the bottom of the unit. This was it can stand firmly in place to the side of your desk, out of the way, but always where you want it to be.

Whether you‚Äôre charging your phone, earbuds, a MacBook, or all three at once, you can expect them to charge up quickly. The Baseus power station is able to deliver a maximum output of 67W. As a point of reference, the USB-C adapter that comes with iPhones nowadays is only 20W. And with GaN6 technology, you can trust your devices will stay safe and cool while charing.

For a limited time, you can secure yourself this versatile 10-in-1 Baseus charging station for $20 off. Get it now for just $30.
